title: Los Angeles Department Water Quality
description: Tap water quality of the Los Angeles Department of Water and Power

body.raw: ## Overview **Oaisys score:** 15 / 100 **Contaminants exceeding health guidelines**: 9 **Total contaminants**: 30 # Contaminants detected **Arsenic**: 430x health guidelines - Potential effect: skin, bladder, and lung cancers; skin discoloration and lesions. - This source 1.72 ppb - Health Guideline: 0.004 ppb - Legal Limit: 10 ppb **Haloacetic acids (HAA9)**: 184x health guidelines - Potential effect: cancer - This source: 11 ppb - Health Guideline: 0.06 ppb - Legal Limit: none **Total trihalomethanes (TTHMs)**: 177x health guidelines - Potential effect: Linked to bladder and colorectal cancer; may affect liver, kidney, and central nervous system - This source: 26.6 ppb - Health Guideline: 0.15 ppb - Legal Limit: 80 ppb **Haloacetic acids (HAA5)**: 103x health guidelines - Potential effect: cancer and may impair fetal growth and development. - This source: 10.3 ppb - Health Guideline: 0.1 ppb - Legal Limit: 60 ppb **Chromium (hexavalent)**: 29x health guidelines - Potential effect: anemia, thrombocytopenia, skin conditions, liver dysfunction, renal failure, rhabdomyolysis, dermatitis, hypoglycemia and stomach cancers. - This source: 0.586 ppb - Health Guideline: 0.02 ppb - Legal Limit: none **Nitrate**: 12x health guidelines - Potential effect: cancer risk, thyroid disease, and adverse reproductive outcomes. - This source: 1.69 ppm - Health Guideline: 0.14 ppm - Legal Limit: 10 ppm **Nitrite**: 7.6x health guidelines - Potential effect: possible cancer risk - This source: 1.07 ppm - Health Guideline: 0.14 ppm - Legal Limit: 10 ppm **Bromate**: 7.3x health guidelines - Potential effect: Potential carcinogen and mutagenic (causes mutations in DNA). - This source: 0.735 ppb - Health Guideline: 0.1 ppb - Legal Limit: 10 ppb **Uranium**: 7x health guidelines - Potential effect: kidney damage, respiratory irritation and accumalation of fluid in the lungs, and increased risk of cancer. - This source: 3.00 pCi/L - Health Guideline: 0.43 pCi/L - Legal Limit: 20 pCi/L ## Sources [EWG](https://www.ewg.org/tapwater/system.php?pws=CA1910067) ## Oaisys Page [See full report](https://www.oasis.ai/blog/los_angeles_tap_water_quality)
